Antiquity offers numerous examples of what may readily be described as cults of necrophilia; perhaps the greatest of them being that of [[Alexander the Great]]'s, which was centered around his supposed [[breast plate]], which was kept in its very own [[mausoleum]] in the [[eponymous]] Egyptian city for over five hundred years. More remarkable still are accounts stating that Alexander's body was placed in a [[sarcophagus]] of pure gold while preserved in a (sterilizing) bath of honey for hundreds of years.
